node.title: Add Deploy/Revert Hooks
node.body:
Add the ability to run arbitrary scripts after a `sqitch deploy` and after a `sqitch revert`. These might be used to, for example, update schema permissions or ownerships in a bulk way. Or maybe they would `VACUUM` and `ANALYZE` a Postgres database.

There should also be a way to disable them via a command-line option (and configuration?) to `deploy` and `revert`. They also should not run when `--log-only` is specified, I think.

Suggested by @bdigital.

node.title: Penalize contra predictions
node.body:
Úprava tréninku a validace

1)Penalize predictions that lead to another trend 

Úprava loss funkce to compare with subsequent (include subsequent trend in pipeline) trend.https://chat.openai.com/share/bd221024-c3c6-42df-84ba-61ed2d8b9b1b

https://chat.openai.com/share/bd221024-c3c6-42df-84ba-61ed2d8b9b1b

2)Validacni target penalizujici ztráty.
Na za cíl evakuaci výkonu, krom standardního targetu jsou označeny všechny datapointy pointy zda v rámci thresholdu vedou k zisku nebo ztrátě. Tim se otestuje skutečná výkonnost modelu.


Tbd zvážit podobné označení i v tréninkových datech.

Možná by to vedlo k samostatným modelům na růst a klesání.

node.title: vectorBT pro jako research tool
node.body:
VectorBT.pro jako nástroj pro:

1.  verifikaci prvotních myšlenek, zjištění zda dana kombinace podmínek nese nějak statistickou výhodu
2. optimalizace/tuning - vyhledání nejlepší možné kombinace parametrů a zobrazení průběhu změny profitu na různých kombinací - cílem je vyhledávat market inefficiencies

### Steps:

- [x] prozkoumat detailně vectorBT
- [ ] nakonfigurovat jednoduchou RSI strategii a vizualizovat výsledek(3d heatmapa) 
- [ ] připojit jako zdroj Alpaca data a případně vlastní data (výčet runneru nebo Batch id) a to jak do ohlc dát tak i do custom indikátoru
- [ ] vytvořit pomocné skript/komponenty, které umožní skládání pro rychlejší vývoj
- [ ] pokusit se aplikovat alespoň částečně do frontendu či případně si tam vytvořit plugin systém a mít chatbot pro fast development plugin.


### Resources:
Existuje chatbot vectorbt backtester, který pracuje s dokumentací od pro verze
Chatbot - https://chat.openai.com/share/df3b1a48-3f0f-459d-bf95-8dae27bfd95f
standardní chatgpt https://chat.openai.com/share/87b319f5-9e1b-4ae8-b979-bcf4c94818ce

Standartní chatgpt bot využívá spíš ne pro verzi a není moc přesný.

node.title: Mr. Resume: AI Resume writer
node.body:
An prompt that helps on resume writing, thanks [Mr.-Ranedeer-AI-Tutor](https://github.com/JushBJJ/Mr.-Ranedeer-AI-Tutor), the prompt is available at https://github.com/MrResume/ResumeBoost/.

The basic idea is to customize your resume according to a specific job description assisted with an AI resume writer, built this last year and made a landing page for that, there could be some potential to build a business around this idea.

Just watched two YouTube videos related to this, very inspiring:

`Gmeek-html<iframe width="560" height="315" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/n5Th-dOI3rI?si=zwi7ftcYA7f26juS" title="YouTube video player" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture; web-share" referrerpolicy="strict-origin-when-cross-origin" allowfullscreen></iframe>`


`Gmeek-html<iframe width="560" height="315" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/G4nsGvL4Fo0?si=r3mQXGNEnDIcILSx" title="YouTube video player" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture; web-share" referrerpolicy="strict-origin-when-cross-origin" allowfullscreen></iframe>`

# ResumeBoost

Resume Boost with ChatGPT / Claude

# Usage

Copy paste [ResumeBoost.txt](ResumeBoost.txt) into https://chat.openai.com or https://claude.ai.

```
/config: Configure your resume preferences, such as experience level, industry, tone style, resume length, and language.

/start: Begin the process of collecting information for your resume.

/done: Generate your resume based on the information you've provided.

/analyse: Analyze your resume and rate it based on a job description.

/continue: If you have more work experiences, education, certifications, or languages to add after generating your resume.

/language [lang]: Change the language of the assistant to the specified language.

/example: Get an example of how your resume might look for a specific job description.
```

node.title: useLayoutEffect
node.body:
A hook to run code just before React paints the DOM. Common use case if determining layout parameters for stuff like scroll preservation etc.
```
Mental model
component code runs --> React vDOM calculated -->                           React paints DOM --> useEffect runs
component code runs --> React vDOM calculated -->  useLayoutEffect runs --> React paints DOM --> useEffect runs
```

- See conversation https://chat.openai.com/share/0b26f548-9912-44fc-816c-fe06d157b4d7
- https://kentcdodds.com/blog/useeffect-vs-uselayouteffect

node.title: Improvments regarding regex
node.body:
### Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.

1. "pregMatch", what preg mean? under the hood it is just regex, replace "preg" with "regex" what will be more understatemenable for people
2. pregFind, pregMatch, pregReplace are accepting regex as string what is not good from performance perspective


### Describe the solution you'd like

1. rename pregFind, pregMatch, pregReplace to regexFind, regexMatch, regexReplace
2. add function to create compiled regex, pcre library used in mta allow it
https://chat.openai.com/share/63d127d9-3abd-418e-8580-e90825bff8bd

local regex = createRegex(...)
regexMatch(regex, ...)

can be beneficial in hot paths

Or do it a bit different, make regex functions compile in background regex, if you do pregMatch(x) for the first time, regex gets compiled and stored in cache, then if you use this function again with same regex it will reuse previously compiled regex.
Remember to add some functionality that will cache up to 1000 regexes, maybe it should be configurable from server config
### Describe alternatives you've considered

/

### Additional context

are there any other functions we can add apart of find, match and replace?

### Security Policy

- [X] I have read and understood the Security Policy and this issue is not about a cheat or security vulnerability.

node.body:
> To predict bounce points machine learning library for time series [sktime](https://www.sktime.org/en/stable/index.html) was used. Specifically, [TimeSeriesForestClassifier](https://github.com/ArtLabss/tennis-tracking/blob/90652b4547311423ea49c4195dde9da9a81f1893/clf.pkl) was trained on 3 variables: x, y coordinates of the ball and V for velocity (V2-V1/t2-t1). Data for training the model - [df.csv](https://github.com/ArtLabss/tennis-tracking/blob/main/bigDF.csv)

Hello! @shukkkur 

I have a few questions about the training data of the bounce model. 

- According to the above content, you gave a label csv for the training data of the bounce model. What's the corresponding videos or images of that? Can you share the data?
- I want to retrain the bounce model, as [this issue](https://github.com/ArtLabss/tennis-tracking/issues/18#issuecomment-1210177886)  offered the training script, but the link is out of date now. Can you upload the script again?

Thanks!

node.title: Going Further with CUDA for Python Programmers" by jh
node.body:
Source: https://chat.openai.com/share/0eafe94e-35ed-4c6e-9e51-f9698f21d4dc

Key sections of the video include:

- Introduction to Optimized Matrix Multiplication
- Shared Memory Techniques for CUDA
- Implementing Shared Memory Optimization in Python
- Translating Python to CUDA and Performance Considerations
- Numba: Bringing Python and CUDA Together
- The Future of AI in Coding

advanced programming techniques for maximizing performance using CUDA with Python. It emphasizes optimizing memory usage, particularly leveraging fast shared memory in CUDA, and builds upon foundational concepts introduced in a "Getting Started" video. The talk compares shared memory to global memory and introduces strategies like tiling to navigate shared memory capacity limitations through a matrix multiplication example.

Jeremy Howard explores different implementations including pure Python, Python with simulated 'shared memory', Numba, and raw CUDA, using ChatGPT for code conversion guidance. The video demonstrates that while Numba-based code may have some overhead, it offers a fast development path compared to raw CUDA.

node.title: Relativní volume indicator
node.body:
uvést volume jako relativní hodnotu v porovnání s průměrem.

Aby byly vidět momentální vzrůsty.

Důležité

Relative Volume consists of Volume divided by Average Volume, where Average Volume is a Simple Moving Average, calculated on the basis of the past 10 periods (not taking into account the current volume bar). Relative Volume = volume / average volume.

Mít jej na všech úrovních.
Ideální bude sma volume divergence

node.title: Add player timers
node.body:
https://chat.openai.com/share/8536d5c6-a8d3-4a95-96ba-f95e36a17500

Side Notes:
- If timer expiration trigger operations on game room, we have to be careful with concurrency issues. In the case of guesser timers, all guessers will have a timer starting at the same time when the story teller submits the story. that means it's going to expire at the same exact time. If they trigger separate actions, those will be executing concurrently against the game room, very likely provoking optimistic concurrency check to fail.

@tdnaugle:
The prototype squared dot product kernel calculation ([my mahout fork](https://github.com/apache/mahout/compare/main...tdnaugle:mahout:kernel-features)) seems to work in both cirq and qiskit. The resulting state vector is expected to be zero since the two input vectors are orthogonal, and cirq yields zero, qiskit yields a very small number (due to simulation?).

I think next steps are to compare this example with the [qiskit reference material](https://qiskit-community.github.io/qiskit-machine-learning/tutorials/03_quantum_kernel.html) and understand some answers to some elementary questions. For instance, what role do quantum circuits play in this simple step (kernel calculation) of a full Quantum Kernel ML algorithm?

@andrewmusselman:
I'll review this as well as the materials you found at https://github.com/PaddlePaddle/Quantum/blob/master/tutorials/machine_learning/QKernel_EN.ipynb

node.title: [Request]: CLI help params to be a little more helpful
node.body:
### Tell us the problem or your need

I'm new to flatpak and bottles. I've a Chromebook and a Ubuntu NUC with KVM VMs and LXC container for other things on both.  I thought I'd learn about bottles.

```
paul@penguin:~$ flatpak run --command=bottles-cli com.usebottles.bottles --help
usage: bottles-cli [-h] [-v] [-j] {info,list,programs,add,tools,reg,edit,new,run,standalone,shell} ...

Bottles is a tool to manage your bottles

positional arguments:
  {info,list,programs,add,tools,reg,edit,new,run,standalone,shell}
                        sub-command help
    info                Show information about Bottles
    list                List entities
    programs            List programs
    add                 Add program
    tools               Launch Wine tools
    reg                 Manage registry
    edit                Edit a bottle configuration
    new                 Create a new bottle
    run                 Run a program
    standalone          Generate a standalone script to launch commands without passing trough Bottles
    shell               Launch commands in a Wine shell

options:
  -h, --help            show this help message and exit
  -v, --version         show program's version number and exit
  -j, --json            Outputs in JSON format
paul@penguin:~$ flatpak run --command=bottles-cli com.usebottles.bottles programs
usage: bottles-cli programs [-h] -b BOTTLE
bottles-cli programs: error: the following arguments are required: -b/--bottle
paul@penguin:~$ flatpak run --command=bottles-cli com.usebottles.bottles list
usage: bottles-cli list [-h] [-f FILTER] {bottles,components}
bottles-cli list: error: the following arguments are required: type
paul@penguin:~$ flatpak run --command=bottles-cli com.usebottles.bottles list -h
usage: bottles-cli list [-h] [-f FILTER] {bottles,components}

positional arguments:
  {bottles,components}  Type of entity

options:
  -h, --help            show this help message and exit
  -f FILTER, --filter FILTER
                        Filter bottles and components (e.g. '-f 'environment:gaming')
paul@penguin:~$ flatpak run --command=bottles-cli com.usebottles.bottles programs -h
usage: bottles-cli programs [-h] -b BOTTLE

options:
  -h, --help            show this help message and exit
  -b BOTTLE, --bottle BOTTLE
                        Bottle name
```

So I now know that programs and list are two sub commands. I have not yet learned of their differentiation. I am guessing one of the two is for local already-installed bottles and the other is for remote you-could-install-this possibilities.

### Describe the solution you'd like

Bottles-cli would be **even better if** `-h` functionality would say a little more about the purpose of the sub command. 

### Other solutions?

_No response_

### Additional context and references

_No response_

Add a typedb generator
node.body:
Add a mapping to https://docs.vaticle.com/docs/schema/overview#typedb-data-model

this originally came up on slack as there is interest in mapping two *data models*, typedb-bio and biolink (expressed using typedb and linkml, respectively). Although a complete mapping of the underlying formalism is not a precondition for mapping the data models, at least understanding the relationships between these can help guide us.

Also we anticipate a typedbgen to be broadly useful, it will make it easy for existing linkml users to explore use of typedb on the backend.

As typedb follows an Entity/Relationship/Attribute model it might be first good to document E/R patterns in LinkML more thoroughly. See:

 - #1487

node.title: proposal for c implementation
node.body:
# C implementation for faster speed

If we are going to use JSF in an inference setting it is important to
be able to run it quickly. Basically, we want a C implementation with
a Python wrapper. In-scope is a simple test that checks the results
are actually faster (and agree to some acceptable numerical precision
e.g. `10**-10`).

There are some notes on C python packaging in the following chat:

https://chat.openai.com/share/d1d5335e-12b3-4480-9ea4-62eb02d24ad1

# (Optional) Suggested solution

- Extend the proposal in this issue
  https://github.com/DGermano8/jsf/issues/1 <-- to make it have a nice
  method name for the compiled version.

## Alternatives

Cython, but that is not good because we can't share it with R users as
easily.

Prompt: Verify "arXiv link"

SLA: 15 seconds

node.body:
En el simulador estamos calculando mal el resultado

https://github.com/ferminrp/compara-tasas/blob/develop/src/components/SimularInvestment/Onboarding.tsx

La formula correcta deberia ser asi:


```
# Cálculo de la tasa diaria
tasa_efectiva_diaria = (1 + TEA)**(1/dias_año) - 1

# Cálculo del valor futuro para dentro de 365 días (1 año)
VF_1_año = VP * (1 + tasa_efectiva_diaria)**dias_año

# Cálculo del valor futuro para 73 días
VF_73_días = VP * (1 + tasa_efectiva_diaria)**73
```

node.title: Wake up the scheduler on resume events or system clock changes
node.body:
### Things to check first

- [X] I have searched the existing issues and didn't find my feature already requested there


### Feature description

If the host is suspended (by entering a sleep state) and then is resumed, the scheduler should be woken up immediately.
Likewise, the scheduler should detect system clock changes whenever possible.

ChatGPT provided some helpful answers on how to accomplish this: https://chat.openai.com/share/a9811e15-29df-462a-9134-b7b231d79133

It also seems like FreeBSD, as of the 13.2 release, also supports timerfd: https://www.freebsd.org/status/report-2023-01-2023-03/#_native_linux_timerfd

### Use case

It would be preferable not to have the scheduler overshoot the next schedule due to the host computer being suspended.

node.title: Implement README Image Retrieval in Backend
node.body:
#### Description:
Develop a feature in the backend to fetch and parse the README file from a specified GitHub repository to extract image URLs. This should help to enhance the data representation and user experience in our application.

#### Tasks:
1. **API Integration**:
   - Set up an endpoint in the backend to receive repository details (owner and repository name).
   - Integrate with the GitHub API to fetch the README file's raw content.

2. **Content Parsing**:
   - Develop a function to parse the README content (likely in markdown format) and extract image URLs.
   - Consider using a reliable parsing library or regular expressions to extract image URLs from the markdown content.

3. **Error Handling**:
   - Implement robust error handling to manage potential issues like invalid repository details or API failures.

4. **Testing**:
   - Develop unit tests to verify the functionality of the new feature.
   - Conduct integration testing to ensure compatibility with the existing backend infrastructure.

5. **Documentation**:
   - Update the API documentation to include details about the new endpoint.
   - Prepare a brief user guide or tutorial demonstrating how to use the new feature.

#### Acceptance Criteria:
- The backend should be able to fetch README files from GitHub repositories accurately.
- Successfully parse the README content to extract image URLs.
- Adequate error handling to manage potential issues and provide meaningful error messages.
- Passing all unit and integration tests.
- Updated documentation reflecting the new changes.

#### Estimated Time: 3-4 days

node.title: Selecting a Sorting Algorithm while another Algorithm is running causes them to both run at the same time
node.body:
Say you select bubble sort, and while that's sorting you select bogo sort.

What will happen is your 3DS will try to bogo sort and bubble sort at the same time.

It's honestly pretty fun to mess around with, and I wouldn't blame you if you decided this was a feature not a bug lol

Anyways, I don't know 3DS development otherwise I'd make a PR, but I asked ChatGPT to solve this issue and it possibly maybe doesn't have the wrong answer (it probably does, but at least this is a starting point): https://chat.openai.com/share/2650aafc-5851-4ca7-9d5f-dd02e240c08c

node.title: No.29発送処理
node.body:
## 概要

配送ができる様に処理の追加する。

## 不具合調査結果

発送処理ページがない

## 修正方針

shipping.html自体は作成済みなのでorder/indexの中に発送処理に飛べるボタンを作成する。

## タスクリスト

**受注一覧ページに受注発送ページへの作成**
- [x] index.htmlを編集（ bugslife\src\main\resources\templates\order\index.html）
  - [x] 新規作成ボタンの下に受注発送ページへとぶリンクを作成
- [x] OrderController（src\main\java\com\example\controller\OrderController.java）にurl（orders/shipping）を作成
  - [x] order/shipping.htmlを返す

### shipping.htmlでcsvのダウンロードができるようにする

- [x] OrderControlerの中にcsvのダウンロードボタンを押すとPOSTできるようにする。（URLは/orders/shipping/download）
  - [x] 返すのはnull
- [x] csvが読み込まれるために新しくshipping.javaのモデルを作成
  - [x] transaction_amounts.csvを見てカラムを作成
    - [x] orderId
    - [x] shippingCode
    - [x] shippingDate
    - [x] deliveryDate
    - [x] deliveryTimezone
  - [x] shippingRepositoryを作成
  - [x] shippingServiceを作成
    - [x] findAll()作成
  - [x] shipping.csvを作成
    - [x] orderId,shippingCode,shippingDate,deliveryDate,deliveryTimezone

**ダウンロードする**

- [x] OrderControllerに@PostMapping("/shipping/download")のメソッドを書く
  - [x] HttpServletResponse responseを書く（HTTPレスポンスオブジェクトを使用してクライアントにデータを送信）
  - [x] CSVファイルのヘッダーを定義（orderId,shippiorngCode,shippingDate,deliveryDate,deliveryTimezone\n）
  - [x] Orderオブジェクトのリストを取得（未発送のもののみ取得。ordered）
  - [x] CSVデータを構築(order.getIdのみ取得、他は,で区切る）（行ごとに改行文字）
  - [x] HTTPレスポンスのコンテンツタイプをtext/csvに設定
  - [x] ファイル名をshipping.csvに設定
  - [x] 出力ストリーム書き込み

**読み込んで一覧表示にする**

- [x] @PostMapping("/shipping")を作成
  - [ ]（ @RequestParam("file") MultipartFile uploadFile　フォームからアップロードされたファイルを受け取る）
  - [x] （RedirectAttributes redirectAttributes　リダイレクト後のページにメッセージを渡すための属性を書く）
  - [x] ファイルの存在チェックなければエラーメッセージ
  - [x] ファイルタイプのチェック
  - [x] orderService.importCSV(uploadFile)を呼び出しOrderDeliveriesでリスト化する
  - [x] 受け取ったOrderDeliveryのデータをセットする
  - [x] OrderDeliveryをModel.addAttributeで表示させる

**出荷ボタンを押したらステータスを発送済みに更新する**

- [x] OrderShippingDataでチェックされてる行の受注ステータスを配送ステータスに更新する
- [x] 引数はOrderShippnigDataにして受け取ってOrderShippingでリスト化する
- [x] OrderShippingをループさせる

node.title: Share upcoming projects/ideas with Riksdagens corpus
node.body:
As the corpus get better my understanding from meeting @MansMeg and @fredrik1984 June 2023 that you see a big interest of using the data

It would be nice if you could share what is thought about in a more structured way to inspire other people...

I myself are very interested in what you see can be used with LLM and the corpus.... I feel we now have a lot of data in Wikidata but I don't see we use the knowledge graphs possibilities...

----
* example 
  * Fia Ewald see [tweet](https://twitter.com/fiaewald/status/1670709377676845056?s=46&t=D6oLWi5wBnn3mz_lLtUSGw) plans starting a SOU pod

We also have an informal Telegram group [Wikidata Sverige](https://t.me/joinchat/FgDj6BTRqdKkYZaCqOB_FA) we're we share ideas/issues

----

It would also be interesting to hear what “corpus” related topics you think about at your Humlab event ”Advancing Research Communication – the role of Humanities in the Digital Era” https://www.umu.se/en/events/advancing-research-communication_11786817/


I asked chatGpt about how wikidata can be part of this equation https://chat.openai.com/share/7089929a-32d3-4729-b1f6-40962f5c53c9

node.title: [참고] 스프링 시큐리티 사용시 토큰 추가 필요한 것들
node.body:
[https://chat.openai.com/share/9fed4528-5632-4c82-87da-c4e40bdfc38b](url)
gpt4에 물어봤을 때 알려주는 것

타임리프 기준으로 form 형식은 자동으로 토큰을 추가해 줘서 괜찮은데 

post 방식 등등은 토큰을 따로 추가해줘야 합니다

레이아웃/메인.html 헤드에 토큰 제가 추가해뒀습니다.
직접 추가할 때는 
`  <meta name="_csrf" th:if="${_csrf != null}" th:content="${_csrf.token}"/>`
`  <meta name="_csrf_header" th:if="${_csrf != null}" th:content="${_csrf.headerName}"/>`
head에 이렇게 넣으면 됩니다. 

토큰이 필요한 포스트 등등과 관련도 자바 스크립트에도 토큰을 추가해 주면 됩니다

작동 유무는 src/main/java/org/kosta/starducks/configs/SecurityConfig.java 여기서 42줄에 csrf가 disable 돼 있는데 주석처리하고 구현한 기능들을 다 한 번씩 시도해 보는 걸 추천합니다. 


### 요약 
ajax 사용 시 : html 헤드에 위에 적혀있듯이 2줄 추가. ajax 스크립트 내부에도 토큰 추가

node.title: Merge MacOS support into pywinauto
node.body:
https://github.com/pywinauto/pywinauto/pull/1213#issuecomment-1565600064

Pywinauto is a library for "Windows GUI Automation with Python (based on text properties)".

MacOS support is almost complete, but there is a bit of polish required on the PR before the maintainer can merge it.

This task involves carrying this over the finish line so that we can use it in our replay strategies in a manner similar to the interaction demonstrated here: https://chat.openai.com/share/7ee3b2de-ca73-40f0-b28d-56990ce68fed

In the process we should also understand the degree to which pywinauto could serve as a replacement for https://github.com/MLDSAI/OpenAdapt/tree/main/openadapt/window

node.title: Optimize Bundle Size
node.body:
Our bundle size is getting way too big for what we have implemented.
![Screenshot 2023-11-10 at 9 37 45 AM](https://github.com/MisterMunchkin/mom-and-me-clinic/assets/9417970/1ddb3aef-ef6a-4a29-8b81-54bef21fd9f1)

I ran a bundle analyzer and it looks like material-tailwind takes up way too much space. We don't really need material tailwind anymore. We can swap it with shadcn components instead. 

![Screenshot 2023-11-10 at 9 37 02 AM](https://github.com/MisterMunchkin/mom-and-me-clinic/assets/9417970/fbca1830-5b18-4d06-bb9b-f95d7b5d3a88)

How I propose we do this would be to search for all material-tailwind references, find the used components, and then swap them for shadcn components. Run bundle analyzer to make sure we actually did something.

@heroicons also seem way too big, but we do use it in a lot of places so lets focus on material tailwind for now

node.title: Challenges Installing PyGObject for OKA Camera RTSP Streaming
node.body:
Issue Description:

I've been encountering significant difficulties while attempting to install PyGObject to set up an RTSP stream for my OKA camera, specifically aiming to utilize H264/H265 encoding. My setup involves WIN11, Python 3.9/3.10/3.11, OAK-1.

Steps Tried:

I've explored multiple avenues to resolve this, including:

- Using Chocolatey to manage the installation on Windows
- Attempting installations via MSYS2 to ensure a Unix-like environment on Windows
- Leveraging Conda environments to manage dependencies
- Direct installations in native Python environments
- Utilizing Windows Subsystem for Linux (WSL) for a more Linux-centric approach

Despite these efforts, I consistently face isse in installing PyGObject (In Conda ENV I was able to install the package but then GstRtspServer error arises).

Questions:

- Has anyone in the community encountered similar issues with PyGObject installations for RTSP streaming setups?
- Are there any known workarounds or solutions that might help circumvent these installation roadblocks?
- If PyGObject isn't a viable option, could someone recommend alternative methods or demos for setting up an RTSP stream using H264/H265 encoding with the OKA camera?

node.title: improve llmjob
node.body:
okay but i think we can make it even more generalizable. assume the llm api has the exact same capabilities as a developer that just started to learn about the issue from absolutely zero experience. he needs to learn from the ground up and do research and he will report every step of the way to find the simplest possible solution that the current state of the art provides. he must use free search apis for the internet and for research papers. and provide references. how can we incorporate that into our current solution? 
ChatGPT
To incorporate the capability for the LLM to conduct research using free internet and research paper APIs, and report every step towards finding a solution, you can enhance the existing Python script to include calls to appropriate search APIs. This enhancement would enable the LLM to simulate the process of a novice developer learning and researching from scratch.

Modifications to the Python Script
Include Search APIs: Integrate APIs for internet search (like DuckDuckGo) and research papers (like arXiv or Semantic Scholar).

Research Process: The script will first use these APIs to gather relevant information based on the issue's content.

Iterative Solution Development: The LLM will then process this information step by step, emulating a learning developer. It will generate a narrative of its learning and decision-making process.

Referencing: Ensure that all used resources are properly referenced in the comments.

Example Python Script (llm_issue_solver.py)
Here's a conceptual outline of how the enhanced script might look:

python
Copy code
import os
import json
import sys
from langchain.llms import OpenAI
from langchain.chains import LLMChain
from langchain.prompts import PromptTemplate
from langchain.tools import DuckDuckGoSearchRun, SemanticScholarSearchRun

# Define prompt templates...

def create_and_run_chain(api_key, template, issue_data, search_results):
    llm = OpenAI(api_key=api_key)
    prompt_template = PromptTemplate.from_template(template)
    search_tools = [DuckDuckGoSearchRun(), SemanticScholarSearchRun()]
    chain = LLMChain(llm=llm, prompt=prompt_template, tools=search_tools)
    return chain.invoke(issue_data, search_results)["text"]

def suggest_solution(issue_file, api_key):
    # ... existing code ...

    # Perform initial search to gather information
    search_results = perform_searches(issue_data)

    # Generate solution with research references
    solution = create_and_run_chain(api_key, SOLUTION_TEMPLATE, input_data, search_results)

    # Post Solution as Comment
    # ... existing code ...

def perform_searches(issue_data):
    # Code to perform internet and research paper searches
    # ...

if __name__ == "__main__":
    # ... existing code ...
Additional Considerations
API Rate Limits: Ensure that the script handles API rate limits and errors gracefully.
Accuracy and Relevance: Since the LLM is simulating a learning process, it's important to ensure the accuracy and relevance of the information it gathers and uses.
Ethical Use: Ensure the ethical use of search APIs, respecting their terms of service.
This approach creates a more dynamic, research-oriented solution-finding process, closely simulating a novice developer's learning curve.

node.body:
## データ収集と管理の仕組みの構築

1. **データ収集スクリプトの作成**

    - まず、非構造化テキストから衛星と計測器具のエンティティを抽出するスクリプトを作成します。このスクリプトは、入力として非構造化テキスト（例えば、ニュース記事やレポート）を受け取り、そのテキストを「satellite-instrument-roberta-NER」または「satellite-instrument-bert-NER」モデルに渡します。そして、モデルの出力（つまり、検出された衛星と計測器具のエンティティ）を収集します。

2. **データ管理スクリプトの作成**

    - 次に、収集したエンティティを整理し、必要に応じて更新、削除、検索できるようにするスクリプトを作成します。このスクリプトは、データベースやファイルシステムなどを使用して、エンティティを効率的に管理します。

node.title: Launch Day Global View of Participation Location
node.body:
**High Level:**
- Based on the location input field the user enters upon sign up, when there’s launch day activity from the user, highlight the city on the globe where the user is contributing from 

- How the globe looks and interacts with the user can be determined in R&D


**User Stories:**

- When a user participates in the countdown actions or makes a post, I want their city to be highlighted on the map so that the more users, participate the more the map is lit up.
- When a public visitor views the webapp, I want them to be able to see the amount of activity and where around the world the activity is happening so that I'm encouraged and also want to participate in the event. 

AC:
- city, country only. City can be optional for users outside the United States. This is a drop down selection field only. 
- we're able to see the whole world — doesn't have to be at one time
- user input is selected by them in their settings or upon registration, no tracking or in-app tracking on our end

node.title: Documentation searchability - 404s, outdated repos
node.body:
Hello,

\<appreciation message irrelevant to progress>
Love the work y'all are doing here! I'm making a jetpack compose multiplatform project targetting desktop and web via js/wasm, and for so many purposes, korlibs have saved me a LOT of pain. I understand they are originally made for the purpose of game development, which has its own unique set of challenges, and these libraries are super high quality production "serious application" grade and they deserve more recognition for just how useful they are outside of game development, too. And I say "y'all", because all OSS is a group effort, but it seems to be mostly just you @soywiz, which is super impressive
\<appreciation message irrelevant to progress>

It seems a lot of utility can be created by a few documentation discoverability improvements.


Ideal flow:
1. as a developer, I am using klock / korlib time, and I am using DateTimeTz. I want to represent a timezoned timerange, so I search to find if there is something for that purpose, similar to DateTimeSpan, but with timezones in mind
2. I do a google search for "korlibs DateTimeSpanTz"
3. if relevant github issues exist, they are shown, otherwise I go to nearest docs or github page

Current flow:
1. omitted for brevity
2. I do a google search for "korlibs DateTimeSpanTz"
3. https://github.com/korlibs/korlibs  shows as 2nd result, which is outdated? though not explicitly labeled as outdated. There are few issues, some may think this is it and just nobody has spoken much.
4. it contains submodules, one for klock which links to https://github.com/korlibs-archive/klock/tree/be84957186ad3805f4ce7abef034f02d1a6224e0
5. this repo says it has migrated to https://github.com/korlibs-archive/korge-next
6. korge-next says it has migrated to https://github.com/korlibs/korge
7. korge repo is up to date, and has a link to the docs at https://docs.korge.org/getting-started/, which are really nice btw!

Some adjacent searches link to things like https://docs.korge.org/klock/dates/ which 404 and some the old klock repo links to https://github.com/korlibs/korge/tree/main/klock which is also a 404

Searching korge repo issues is fine once I end up there. I do like separate repo pages for discoverability, but I understand that comes with quite an overhead too so I understand them all being one.

Probably all that should be done is for archived repos to directly link to https://github.com/korlibs/korge, and possibly for https://github.com/korlibs/korlibs to be archived and a link added too?

Some SEO on the docs would be awesome but I don't know much about SEO and potentially that is quite a hassle, maybe someone who does know about SEO can chime in though.

node.title: Support Encrypted Private Key PEM Format
node.body:
### Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.

Currently our root key and asymmetric key crypto uses JWK.

However there's an older format "encrypted PKCS#8 pem" that is more widely understood.

We can support a function in our keys utils called:

```
privateKeyToPEMEncrypted
privateKeyFromPEMEncrypted
```

### Describe the solution you'd like

See the notes:

* https://github.com/MatrixAI/Polykey/issues/508#issuecomment-1445649386
* https://github.com/MatrixAI/Polykey/issues/508#issuecomment-1445649446
* https://github.com/MatrixAI/Polykey/issues/508#issuecomment-1445654109
* https://github.com/MatrixAI/Polykey/issues/508#issuecomment-1522871908

### Describe alternatives you've considered

Continue using JWK. This encrypted PEM file is primarily for compatibility reasons.

### Additional context

* https://github.com/MatrixAI/Polykey/issues/508

node.title: Log parser
node.body:
program ::= state_declaration*

state_declaration ::= "State" state_number ":" state_body

state_number ::= digit+

state_body ::= action* transition*

action ::= "Shifting" "(" token ")" "to state" state_number
           | "Reducing" production

transition ::= "Lookahead token is now" lookahead_token lookahead_position
               (transition_action | epsilon)

lookahead_token ::= token
lookahead_position ::= "(" position_start "-" position_end ")"

transition_action ::= "Shifting" "(" token ")" "to state" state_number
                   | "Reducing" production
                   | "Initiating error handling"
                   | "Fatal error: exception" exception_type

epsilon ::= "Initiating error handling" | "Fatal error: exception" exception_type

production ::= production_rule | production_factor | production_term
              | production_concatenation | production_alternation

production_rule ::= rule_lhs "::=" rhs

rule_lhs ::= identifier

rhs ::= alternation

alternation ::= concatenation ("BAR" concatenation)*

concatenation ::= factor+
               | factor "list" "(" identifier ")" factor

factor ::= identifier | token | literal | "(" alternation ")"
         | "STAR" | "PLUS" | "QMARK" | "NEWLINE" | "COLONCOLONEQUAL"
         | "LPAREN" | "RPAREN" | "LBRACE" | "RBRACE" | "LBRACKET" | "RBRACKET"
         | "BAR" | "EOF" | "REGEX" | "DIGIT" | "DEBUG"

identifier ::= letter (letter | digit)*

token ::= letter (letter | digit)*

literal ::= string

string ::= "\"" (character | escape_sequence)* "\""

character ::= any printable ASCII character except "\"" and "\"

escape_sequence ::= "\\" ( "\"" | "\\" | "b" | "f" | "n" | "r" | "t" )

letter ::= any ASCII letter

digit ::= any ASCII digit

exception_type ::= identifier

position_start ::= digit+
position_end ::= digit+

https://chat.openai.com/share/bb98fc53-a9bb-4f6b-8d0f-f49082e90b90

node.title: No.33 取引金額 権限設定・403エラー
node.body:
## 概要
取引金額のCUD操作は管理者のみ可能だが、権限設定が無いため誰でも可能となっている。権限設定と403エラーハンドリングを追加する。
## 修正方針
security/WebSecurityConfigクラス内securityFilterChainメソッドのhttp.authorizeHttpRequests()内で権限によるアクセスの拒否設定を追加する。
ADMIN権限のないユーザーがアクセスしようとすると、特別にエラーハンドリングを設定しなくても403が出る。
## タスクリスト

### WebSecurityConfigでADMINユーザーのみアクセス許可設定
- [x] securityFilterChainメソッド内authorizeHttpRequests((requests) -> requests.\~)の\~部分に設定を追加
  - [x] .anyRequest().authenticated()の上に.requestMatchers(通信方法, "ページパス").hasRole("ADMIN")を制限する分追加
    - [x] 取引金額の作成を制限
      - [x] 通信方法：HttpMethod.POST、ページパス：/transactionAmounts
    - [x] 取引金額の編集を制限
      - [x] 通信方法：HttpMethod.PUT、ページパス：/transactionAmounts
    - [x] 取引金額の削除を制限
      - [x] 通信方法：HttpMethod.DELETE、ページパス：/transactionAmounts/{id}
    - [x] CSVファイルのアップロードを制限
      - [x] 通信方法：HttpMethod.POST、ページパス：/transactionAmounts/{c_id}/upload_csv
- [x] 動作確認
  - [x] userでログインしCUD操作時403エラーが出るか
  - [x] adminでログインしCUD操作時403エラーが出ないか

### Issue 情報更新

<!-- 完了したらチェックを入れること -->
<!-- Issueのコメントに記載すること -->

- [x] 回答までのアプローチ
- [x] プロンプト履歴
<!--
下記を参考にIssueにPullRequesutを紐づけること
https://docs.github.com/ja/issues/tracking-your-work-with-issues/linking-a-pull-request-to-an-issue
-->
- [x] PullRequest の紐付け

node.title: No.38 apps編集 IEでの画像プレビュー表示
node.body:
## 概要
IEで画像選択時に画像のプレビューが表示されない。
## 不具合調査結果
app/form.html内\<script>での画像選択時にプレビューを表示させるJSの記述が、一部IEでサポートされていない。
## 修正方針
該当のJSの記述をIEでサポートされた形式に書き換える。
## タスクリスト

### app/form.htmlの\<script>内でIEでサポートされていない記述を変更
- [x] 変数の宣言ワードをvarに統一
- [x] 「imagePreview.style = ...」を「imagePreview.style.(width/heightのどちらか) = ...」の形式に変更
- [x] imageFile.after(imagePreview)をimageFile.parentNode.insertBefore(imagePreview, imageFile.nextSibling)に変更

### 動作確認
- [x] IEでプレビューが表示される
- [x] Chromeでプレビューが表示される

### Issue 情報更新

<!-- 完了したらチェックを入れること -->
<!-- Issueのコメントに記載すること -->

- [x] 回答までのアプローチ
- [x] プロンプト履歴
<!--
下記を参考にIssueにPullRequesutを紐づけること
https://docs.github.com/ja/issues/tracking-your-work-with-issues/linking-a-pull-request-to-an-issue
-->
- [x] PullRequest の紐付け

node.title: ChatGPT interpretes prompt as wanting and example of JSON, not JSON with actual data for the user request
node.body:
Hello

I've been playing around with a meal plan app for which I've been working a lot on how to get ChatGPT to give the result as JSON.
For this reason, when I heard about TypeChat, I thought that, that sounded like a perfect solution.

Not sure whether its due to my type definitions are a bit complex, but the resulting prompts make ChatGPT interpret that I want an example on how  a resulting JSON could look. 

Here's a link to a chat I made with the prompt generated by Typechat.

https://chat.openai.com/share/5bce537a-f9b8-4fbc-afd7-7ebb724b3f89

In my own approach I've had success with ending my prompt with the type definition. Like for example:

"Your response should be in JSON format {meals: {"description": string, "ingredients": {"name": string, "quantity": number, "unit": string}[], "directions": string[]}[]}."

Have you considered this sort of approach?

node.title: Support gRPC over websocket to allow direct access from browsers
node.body:
## Motivation

Using lightwalletd from the browser currently requires a proxy server to provide an http/1.1 transport. or gRPC over websocket.

Integrating gRPC over websocket support will offer web developers the direct access to lightwalletd that native developers currently enjoy.

node.title: Eigenvalue decomposition derivatives needed
node.body:
Hi,

This is somewhat of an open issue.  An eigenvalue decomposition is necessary for line mixing ECS computations to be effective.  This is done.  We also need partial derivatives w.r.t. user input to fit with the rest of ARTS.  I would like these derivatives to be analytical but I do not know how to take the partial derivatives of an eigenvalue decomposition.  I need help here.

The specific function has been marked "FIXME:  (Added 2021-01-19; Richard Larsson)" and is located in `linemixing.cc` at lines 13-58 at the merging of #281 .  I can add computations of `dW`, `dpop`, and `ddip` if someone knows how to perform the required computations.

node.title: [Feature Request]:  gpts支持
node.body:
### Problem Description

在浏览其他gpt套壳网站的时候，发现有一些早已经支持了gpts，希望作者大大在这个项目也可以加下该功能




### Solution Description

例如:https://gptgod.online/#/api?tab=doc

使用上一般是先切换到
![image](https://github.com/Hk-Gosuto/ChatGPT-Next-Web-LangChain/assets/8509438/2f09f433-0ee1-44a6-a84e-ddada26cc2a2)
search-gpts-chat的模型，去搜索gpts的id,
搜索结果如下，其中标红的即为gpts的id,
![image](https://github.com/Hk-Gosuto/ChatGPT-Next-Web-LangChain/assets/8509438/c4e7aac4-a161-4f30-91e3-e58a64abe456)

然后切换到模型gpt-4-gizmo，可以在下图看到可以在右边编辑gpts的id填入，然后就可以跟gpts进行交互了。
![image](https://github.com/Hk-Gosuto/ChatGPT-Next-Web-LangChain/assets/8509438/26303aaa-831d-47cd-b766-84e7c379c053)

该网站有接入文档供参考，链接为https://gptgod.online/#/api?tab=doc，内容如下：


gpts模型接入
介绍
[什么是gpts?](https://zhuanlan.zhihu.com/p/666176123), 简而言之就是openai开发的插件商店，用户可以自定义自己的gpts，针对各种场景专门使用，例如论文搜索、翻译、代码补全等等，这里只是简单介绍一下如何接入，更多的gpts使用方法请自行搜索

如何找到gpts id
找到gpts的ID，请参考如下步骤

首先需要找到你需要的gpts，如何寻找呢？随便找一个搜索引擎，这里以bing为例子
例如我想找到翻译相关的gpts，搜索输入 site:chat.openai.com/g 翻译, 即可看到搜索结果中一堆gpts插件 [搜索翻译](https://www.bing.com/search?q=site%3Achat.openai.com%2Fg+%E7%BF%BB%E8%AF%91&form=QBLH&sp=-1&lq=0&pq=site%3Achat.openai.com%2Fg+fan+yi)
找到你需要的gpts，点击进入
看到地址栏的地址，找到g-xxxxxxx，例如https://chat.openai.com/g/g-IZb9C11iR-ying-wen-fan-yi-zhuan-jia中的g-IZb9C11iR，即为gpts的id
此时得到模型名称就是 gpt-4-gizmo-g-IZb9C11iR ,那么 gizmo_id就是 g-IZb9C11iR
gpts请求
接入方式有两种，请求地址都是 https://api.gptgod.online/v1/chat/completions, 请求参数上有点区别，返回参数上和一般的gpt-3.5-turbo模型一致

动态model
和普通gpt-3.5-turbo模型接入方式保持一致，唯一的参数区别就是model: gpt-4-gizmo-g-xxxxxx
静态model
model固定为 gpt-4-gizmo , 需要在body中指定gizmo_id, 例如gizmo_id: g-IZb9C11iR
根据ID查询gpts详情
请求代码示例
python
javascript
typescript
golang
java
rust
php
curl
fetch("https://api.gptgod.online/v1/gpts/?id=g-yJoNW6R47", {
    method: "GET",
    headers: {
        "Authorization": "Bearer {{secret}}"
    }
})
.then(response => response.text())
.then(result => console.log(result))
.catch(error => console.log('error', error));

node.title: No.22 Apps詳細 デザイン修正
node.body:
## 概要
ボタンの色、文字フォントが画面設計書と異なる。また、画面幅縮小時の文字サイズが大きくなっている。
## 不具合調査結果
ボタン配色、文字フォントは各要素のclass属性値の間違いが原因で、誤ったスタイルがBootstrapとapp.cssによって付与されている。画面幅縮小時の文字サイズも、間違ったclass属性値によってapp.cssで制御されている。
## 修正方針
各ボタンのclass属性値を修正し配色を変更する。文字フォント、画面幅縮小時の文字サイズについては該当の要素のclass属性値を削除する。
## タスクリスト

### View(HTML,JS)

- [x] 各ボタンの配色変更
- [x] フォント、画面幅縮小時の文字サイズが異なる要素の修正
- [x] 画面設計書の通りになるようHTMLを修正

### Issue 情報更新

<!-- 完了したらチェックを入れること -->
<!-- Issueのコメントに記載すること -->

- [x] 回答までのアプローチ
- [x] プロンプト履歴
<!--
下記を参考にIssueにPullRequesutを紐づけること

node.title: ユーザビリティテスト【消費電力】
No.32 取引先/取引金額 CSVアップロードの非同期化
node.body:
## 概要
取引金額のCSVデータアップロードが非同期化されていないため、アップロードステータス表示も含め実装する。
## 修正方針
TransactionAmountService内importCSVメソッドのwhile文で、「取引金額のインスタンス生成」～「取引金額の保存」をCompletableFutureを用いて非同期化する。また、importCSVメソッドがupdatedImpを返すようにreturn分の追加と返り値の型を変更する。
TransactionAmountController内uploadCSVFileメソッドでFileImportInfo型の変数resultにimportCSVメソッドを代入し、RedirectAttributesオブジェクトにresult.getStatus().getValue()を追加する。
company/show.htmlにresult.getStatus().getValue()を表示する部分を追加する。
## タスクリスト

### 取引金額CSVインポート処理の変更
- [x] TransactionAmountService内importCSVメソッドでの変更
  - [x] while文内
    - [x] メソッドの返り値の型をvoid -> FileImportInfoに変更
    - [x] while文の直前にList\<CompletableFuture\<Void>>オブジェクトとCompletableFuture\<Void>型の変数futureを宣言
    - [x] futureにCompletableFuture.runAsync(() -> {指定記述})を代入し非同期処理
      - [x] 指定記述の部分にtry-catch文を記述
      - [x] try文内に「取引金額のインスタンス生成」～「取引金額の保存」の記述を移す
      - [x] catch文内でupdatedImpのstatusをFileImportStatus.ERRORに変更し、スタックトレースを出力
    - [x] List\<CompletableFuture\<Void>>オブジェクトにfutureを追加
  - [x] CompletableFuture\<Void>型の変数allOfに、CompletableFuture.allOf(引数)を代入
    - [x] 引数は、List\<CompletableFuture\<Void>>オブジェクトを大きさ0の配列にしたもの
  - [x] allOf.thenApply(ignoredResult ->{処理});で全非同期処理が完了した後の処理を記述
    - [x] updatedImpのステータスがERROR出ない場合のみステータスをCOMPLETEにする
    - [x] updatedImpの完了日時に現在日時をセットし保存
    - [x] updatedImpを返却
  - [x] allOf.thenApply()以下に非同期処理が完了しなかった時の処理を記述
    - [x] updatedImpを返却
  - [x] CSVファイルの取り込みでエラーが発生したときのcatch文内で、エラーをスローしていたものを、updatedImpを保存しupdatedImpを返却するよう変更
  - [x] 取り込み完了時の処理を移動したためfinally文を削除
- [x] TransactionAmountController内uploadCSVFile()メソッドでの変更
  - [x] CSVファイルのインポート処理の前にFileImportInfo型の変数resultを宣言
  - [x] CSVファイルのインポート処理のtry文内でresuletにimportCSVメソッドを代入
  - [x] RedirectAttributesオブジェクトにresult.getStatus().getValue()を"importResult"として追加

### 表示項目の変更
- [x] company/show.htmlでの変更
  - [x] 取引金額 新規追加の\<a>の後に取り込みステータスを表示
    - [x] 「取引金額CSV: 」を内包した\<span>を追加
    - [x] 2つの\<span>にth:if属性でimportResultがある場合と無い場合の表示を追加
      - [x] ある場合、th:text属性でimportResultを表示
      - [x] 無い場合、無しと表示

node.title: Distribute Robo commands via Packagist [4h]
node.body:
We have some client projects where we compose custom code via composer. It has a number of benefits:
 - versioned properly
 - easy to upgrade / downgrade
 - coherent with other contrib code

We have this thing that we copy-paste Robo commands from Drupal Starter. From some projects, we diverge so much from the origin that we can't do better. But many projects are really really similar to Starter when it comes to tooling, but yet, each one is a little bit different.

If we'd try to publish a composer package that holds our commands, we would be able to upgrade (let's say to have the latest release notes generation or fixes in the deploy flow) via composer, just like as we upgrade Drupal core.

node.title: Figure out how to store very large texts + async stuff
node.body:
Right now each book object has a "text" field to which is being saved the entire text of the book. This is clearly unworkable! It takes a long time and is not very efficient spacewise either.

Also when I check in on an individual book it hits an error: **BlockingIOError: [Errno 11] write could not complete without blocking before**  before getting to the end of the book. ChatGPT suggests asynchronicity will be helpful here (which I know you already suggested Ryan and want to talk about), as follows:
```
from databases import Database
from httpx import AsyncClient
from sqlalchemy import select

database = Database(sqlite_url)
async_client = AsyncClient()

async def populate_books():
    async with database.connect():
        query = select(Book).limit(1)
        if await database.fetch_one(query) is None:
            book_data = await get_books()
            for book in book_data:
                query = Book.insert().values(title=book['title'], author=book['author'], url=book['url'])
                await database.execute(query)
        first_book = await database.fetch_one(query)
        if first_book is not None and first_book.text is None:
            books = await database.fetch_all(select(Book))
            for book in books:
                book.text = await get_text(book.url)
                # Update the book with new text
                query = Book.update().where(Book.id == book.id).values(text=book.text)
                await database.execute(query)
```
Which is interesting but only (maybe) solves the issue of time complexity but not space complexity.

Given that the app will likely only be hosted locally, putting things into txt files could work but the text still needs to make it into the database somehow...

node.title: time dependent a/drift and b/noise terms
node.body:
If we want to have $dX = sigma(t) * dWt$, should we just add an extra variable $dt = 1 *dt$ and then use this variable as time ?
For instance,
 ```python
# x[0] = time, x[1] = X, dX = (cos(t)+1.1) * dWt
pychastic.sde_problem.SDEProblem(
    lambda x: jnp.array([1., 0.]),
    lambda x: jnp.array([[0, 0], [0, (jnp.cos(x[0]) + 1.1)]]),
    x0=[0, 1],
    tmax=10,
)
```
It works as expected but would it be better to have for drift and noise, a signature like `lambda t,x: ...` ?

node.title: No.34 基幹 公開時用エラーページ
node.body:
## 概要
内部エラー発生時にそのままスタックトレースが出力されているが、公開時には404または500ページを表示したい。
404以外のエラー全てで表示される500ページを作成し、500ページでスタックトレースを表示するかをserver.error.include-stacktraceプロパティで切り替えられるようにする。
## 修正方針
404.htmlを踏襲したerror/500.htmlを作成し、500.htmlではスタックトレースがある場合に表示させるようにする。
DefaultErrorAttributesクラスを継承したGlobalExceptionHandlerクラスを作成し、HTTPステータスが404の時は404.htmlを、404以外の時は500.htmlを表示させる。また、server.error.include-stacktraceプロパティの値がneverの時にスタックトレースを表示させないようにする。
開発環境の500ページでスタックトレースを確認した後、server.error.include-stacktraceプロパティをneverに変更し、公開時の500ページでスタックトレースが表示されないことを確認する。
## タスクリスト

### 500.htmlの作成
- [x] 404.htmlの記述をもとに作成する
- [x] 404.htmlからの変更
  - [x] \<h1>の内容を500に変更し、.pageの\<div>の内容を削除
  - [x] 内容を削除した\<div>の子要素として\<pre>を追加し、\<pre>にth:text="${stackTrace}"を追加

### GlobalExceptionHandlerクラスの作成
- [x] DefaultErrorAttributesクラスを継承し、Environmentクラス(org.springframework.core.env)をDIしておく
- [x] {ControllerAdvice}, {Controller}アノテーションをクラスに付与
- [x] WebRequestオブジェクトを渡すとリクエストのHttpStatusを返すgetStatus(WebRequest)メソッドを作成
  - [x] Object型の変数statusにWebRequestオブジェクト.getAttribute(引数2つ)を代入してステータスを取得
    - [x] 引数は"javax.servlet.error.status_code"とWebRequest.SCOPE_REQUESTの2つ
  - [x] statusがnullでないとき、HttpStatus.valueOf((Integer)status)を返却
  - [x] デフォルトはHttpStatus.INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR(500エラー)を返却
- [x] {ExceptionHandler(Exception.class)}アノテーションを付与したhandleException(引数)メソッドを作成
  - [x] 引数はException ex, WebRequest request, Model model
  - [x] HttpStatus型の変数statusにgetStatus(request)メソッドを代入
  - [x] statusがHttpStatus.NOT_FOUND(404エラー)のとき、"error/404"を返却
  - [x] それ以外の時、Environmentオブジェクトからserver.error.include-stacktraceプロパティの値を取得しておく
    - [x] プロパティの値がneverでない時、exからPrintWriter、StringWriterを介してスタックトレースを取得
      - [x] StringWriter、PrintWriterの順に宣言(PrintWriterの引数にはStringWriterの変数)
      - [x] ex.printStackTrace(PrintWriterの変数)でスタックトレースを取得
      - [x] modelにStringWriter変数.toString()を"stackTrace"として追加
    - [x] "error/500"を返却

### 500.htmlの整形
- [x] \<head>の\<style>を変更
  - [x] .sectionにheight: 85vh;を追加
  - [x] .pageを.boxに変更(\<body>の該当class値も変更)し、内容をmargin: 2rem 0;とheight: 60%;に変更
  - [x] \<pre>にclass="stackTrace"を追加し、.stackTraceを追加
    - [x] 内容はheight: 100%;、font-size: large;、text-align: left;、color: #444;、overflow: scroll;

### 動作確認(手順は不具合報告書No.34再現手順を参照)
- [x] application.propertiesのserver.error.include-stacktraceプロパティがalwaysの時、500エラーページ遷移時にスタックトレースが表示されている
  - [x] neverの時、スタックトレースが表示されていない
- [x] 404エラーの時は404ページに遷移している

node.title: Bug: `TestRefreshDatasetGroupTables`: extension not in test schema
node.body:
## Overview When running `test_load_dataset_group()`, The following error arises: ``` operator class "gin_trgm_ops" does not exist for access method "gin" ``` Here's my ChatGPT conversation and 2 of the threads I looked through. - https://chat.openai.com/share/341bb10f-74d0-4f99-ae48-c2235500c6b3 - https://github.com/PostgresApp/PostgresApp/issues/335 - https://dba.stackexchange.com/questions/234463/gin-trgm-ops-index-creation-fails I tried all the suggestions that made sense at these links. Everything in my setup seems correct. The extension appears to be enabled in the test schema; in fact for all schema. Search path seems correct. I even reinstalled the extensions (on all schema), and still the error. ## Temporary solution For now, I've added the following try/except in `refresh_derived_tables_exec()` which will skip creating this index if running on test schema, as it is not necessary.
Python code

```py for statement in statements: try: run_sql(con, statement) except ProgrammingError as err: if schema == 'test_n3c' and 'does not exist for access method' in str(err): print('Warning: A known error occurred while trying to create an extension-based index in the test' ' schema. For now, we\'re skipping creation of this index here as is not necessary for ' 'testing.', file=sys.stderr) continue raise err ```

node.title: Can you use a YAML config file with ROS2 without having to change where the file is located in the code.
node.body:
The last update I made to the ROS2 stuff was incorporating a YAML config file. The yaml file is located under params_pkg/params/robot_params.yaml and a change needs to be made to the tank control package so it works in your enviornment. This line in the tank_control_pkg/tank_control_pkg/tank_control.py file needs line 88 change to your environment : self.config = self.load_yaml_config("/home/jeffh/ros2_ws/src/params_pkg/params/robot_params.yaml")

In my case you can see my home folder is jeffh, that is probably what needs to be changed on yours as well. 

Looks like the same needs to be changed for the robot_peripherals_pkg.py as well. Line 19 self.config = self.load_yaml_config("/home/jeffh/ros2_ws/src/params_pkg/params/robot_params.yaml")


Is there a way for us to use a yaml config file without having to change the code to the correct user's home folder?

node.title: Share content securely
node.body:
What I would like:
I can post a content, anybody on my allow list can read the message. The content is fully public, but encrypted. You should be able to have 1-n on the allow list. This will allow you to have 1 on 1 chat, a chat group, a message board, .... or any type of JSON. 

The server you post to server it would go to a nostr server(pub/sub , blue sky, any other protocol)

When a user wants to read s message he sends his identity to a smart contract, the contract will provide private key if user is on allow list

Here is chat about the smart contract
https://chat.openai.com/share/bdd1a777-5b28-4177-b330-6e6993c97a67

*Plang code*

Post
- encrypt %content%, write to %encryptedContent%
- hash %hashedEC%
- get private key, write to %pk%
- write to smart contract 0x123 %pk% %hashedEC%
- publish public message %encryptedContent%

Listen
- get messages from %userAdressILike%, write to %messages%
- for each %messages%, call !Decode 

Decode
- hash %message%, write to %hm%
- get private key from smart contract 0x, %pk%, %hm%
- decrypt %message% %pk%, write to %content%
- / etc.  ..... show content, could also store in db

node.title: Models we should test
node.body:
As part of our ongoing efforts to improve the performance and accuracy of our predictive models, we need to evaluate a variety of machine learning and deep learning algorithms. Here's a list of models we should consider testing:

- [x] Linear Regression
  * Rationale: A good baseline model. If our data has a linear relationship, this model might perform surprisingly well.
  * Implementation: Scikit-learn or Statsmodels can be used.
  * Potential Challenges: Assumes a linear relationship between predictors and target variable
- [x] Random Forest
  * Rationale: An ensemble method that can capture complex non-linear relationships in the data.
  * Implementation: Scikit-learn offers a straightforward implementation.
  * Potential Challenges: Might overfit on very noisy data. Hyperparameter tuning is essential.
- [x] #13
  * Rationale: Boosting technique that builds trees iteratively, correcting errors from previous trees.
  * Implementation: We can use libraries like XGBoost or LightGBM.
  * Potential Challenges: Requires careful tuning of learning rate and tree depth.
- [x] #10
  * Rationale: Given its capacity to remember patterns over long sequences, it might be especially useful if our data has temporal sequences or time-series components.
  * Implementation: Consider using TensorFlow, pytorch or Keras for implementation.
  * Potential Challenges: LSTMs can be computationally intensive and might require more time to train.

- [x] ARIMA (AutoRegressive Integrated Moving Average)
  * Rationale: ARIMA, which stands for AutoRegressive Integrated Moving Average, is a classical time series forecasting method. It's designed to capture autoregressive patterns (relationships between an observation and a number of lagged observations) and moving average patterns (relationship between an observation and a residual error from a moving average model applied to lagged observations) in the data. The integrated component refers to the idea of differencing the data to make the time series stationary.
  * Implementation: 
  * Potential Challenges:
    * Overfitting: Models with too many parameters might fit the training data exceptionally well but perform poorly on new data.
    * Stationarity Assumption: ARIMA requires the data to be stationary. Even after differencing, some series might remain non-stationary.
    * Seasonality: ARIMA doesn't handle seasonality by default. If the data has a clear seasonal pattern, SARIMA (Seasonal ARIMA) might be more appropriate.
    * Noise: If the time series is too noisy, ARIMA might not be the best choice. Pre-processing or smoothing might be necessary.
Computational Time: For large datasets or when performing grid search for hyperparameters, ARIMA can be computationally intensive.

- [x] #17
  * Rationale: 1D CNNs are highly effective for sequence data where spatial relationships exist, such as time series data or natural language. They can extract local features and learn spatial hierarchies which can be crucial for understanding complex patterns in sequence data.
  * Implementation: TensorFlow and Keras offer user-friendly APIs to build 1D Convolutional Neural Networks. Define convolutional layers with filters and kernels optimized for 1D sequence data.
  * Potential Challenges:
    * Data Requirements: CNNs usually require a large amount of data to generalize well.
    * Hyperparameter Tuning: Choosing the right architecture, kernel sizes, and the number of filters can be crucial and might require extensive experimentation.
    * Overfitting: Without adequate regularization, CNNs can overfit to the training data, especially when the amount of training data is limited. 

- [x] #16
  * Rationale: Developed by Facebook, Prophet is designed for forecasting with daily observations that display patterns on different time scales. It works well with time series that have strong seasonal effects and several seasons of historical data. Prophet is robust to missing data and shifts in the trend, and typically handles outliers well.
  * Implementation:  it can be implemented using the fbprophet package. The implementation is quite straightforward — it primarily requires a dataframe with two columns: ds (date) and y (value to predict).
  * Potential Challenges:
    * Seasonality Assumption: Prophet might not perform well if the data doesn’t exhibit any clear seasonality.
    * Hyperparameter Tuning: While Prophet performs well out of the box, tuning seasonality and holiday parameters can sometimes be tricky and require domain knowledge.
    * Uncertainty Intervals: The uncertainty intervals provided by Prophet are often too wide to be useful in practice, and might require additional post-processing or calibration.
    * Scalability: For very large datasets, Prophet can be computationally intensive and might require considerable time to train. 

- [ ]  ETS (Exponential Smoothing State Space Model)
  * Rationale: ETS is a widely-used forecasting method for time-series data, particularly effective for data with trends and seasonality. It applies exponential smoothing to various components of the time series (Error, Trend, Seasonality), hence the acronym ETS.
  * Implementation: Libraries like statsmodels in Python offer implementation of ETS models.
  * Potential Challenges:
    * Parameter Selection: Choosing the right error, trend, and seasonality components and their forms (additive or multiplicative) can significantly affect performance.
    * Stationarity and Seasonality: While ETS handles seasonality, it may not perform well with non-stationary data without appropriate differencing.
    * Forecast Confidence: ETS models might produce overly optimistic confidence intervals.
- [x] Catboost
  * Rationale: Catboost is a high-performance gradient boosting library, particularly optimized for categorical data. It can handle categorical features automatically and is known for its robustness and efficiency.
  * Implementation: Catboost has its own standalone library and can be easily implemented in Python.
  * Potential Challenges:
    * Overfitting: Like other boosting methods, it can overfit if not tuned properly.
    * Parameter Tuning: Optimal performance requires tuning of parameters like learning rate, depth of trees, etc.
    * Computational Resource: Can be resource-intensive, especially with large datasets and complex models.
- [x] AutoGluon
  * Rationale: AutoGluon automates machine learning tasks, making it easier to achieve strong predictive performance with minimal user intervention. It is particularly useful for those who may not have extensive machine learning expertise.
  * Implementation: AutoGluon offers a high-level API in Python, streamlining the machine learning pipeline, including automatic model selection and hyperparameter tuning.
  * Potential Challenges:
    * Customization Limitations: While it's great for quick results, there may be limitations in fine-tuning and customizing models for specific tasks.
    * Resource Intensity: AutoGluon can be resource-intensive, as it evaluates multiple models.
    * Understanding Results: The automated nature might obscure the understanding of why certain models work better than others in some cases.
- [x] SVR
  * Rationale: SVR applies the principles of Support Vector Machines (SVM) for regression tasks. It is effective for both linear and non-linear regressions and is known for its robustness, particularly in high-dimensional space.
  * Implementation: Implemented using libraries such as Scikit-learn in Python.
  * Potential Challenges:
Kernel Choice: Selecting the right kernel function (linear, polynomial, RBF, etc.) is crucial and can be challenging.
    * Parameter Tuning: Parameters like C (regularization), gamma (for non-linear SVR), and epsilon (margin of tolerance) require careful tuning.
    * Scalability: SVR can be computationally intensive, especially for large datasets.
    * Sparse Data Handling: SVR might not perform well with very sparse data.

node.body:
## 概要
要件定義書に沿って受注発送ページを作成する。order/shipping.htmlは作成済みであるため、処理の実装を行う。
## 修正方針
要件定義書、orders.mdをもとに修正する。
DB上にorder_deliveriesテーブルを作成する。
order_deliveriesをもとにModel, Repository, Serviceを実装する。
order/index.htmlに受注発送ページへのリンクを設置する。
ShippingControllerを作成し、受注発送ページ用の処理を記述する。
CSVのダウンロード・アップロードの処理はCampainController等を参考に実装する。
## タスクリスト

### DB
- [x] order.mdを参照しorder_deliveriesテーブルの作成

### ShippingController
- [x] ShippingControllerを作成する
- [x] OrderDeliveryServiceのDI

- [x] 未発送受注の一覧表示用index(Model)メソッドを作成

  - [x] Modelオブジェクトにordersを追加
  - [x] "order/shipping"を返却
  
- [x] DBからの取得データをCSV形式に変換するconvertDataToCsv(List\<OrderDelivery>)メソッドの作成
  - [x] StringBuilderオブジェクトを作成
  - [x] StringBuilderオブジェクトにデータのカラムヘッダーと改行記号を追加
  - [x] List\<OrderDelivery>の各OrderDeliveryをすべてStringBuilderオブジェクトに追加
    - [x] OrderDeliveryの各フィールドと対応するOrderのstatusフィールドについて、フィールド間に","を入れるようにStringBuilderオブジェクトに追加
    - [x] OrderDeliveryの最後のフィールドを追加した後は","の代わりに改行記号を追加
  - [x] StringBuilderオブジェクトをStringに変換し返却
  
- [x] CSVのダウンロード処理用download(HttpServletResponse, RedirectAttributes)メソッドを作成
  - [x] try文内でダウンロード処理
    - [x] OrderServiceのfindByStatus(ordered)メソッドをList\<Order>型の変数ordersに代入
    - [x] for文とorderDeliveryServiceのfindById()を利用し、List\<OrderDelivery>型の変数orderDeliveriesDataにOrderDeliveryを追加
    - [x] convertDataToCsv(orderDeliveriesData)メソッドをString型の変数csvDataに代入
    - [x] CampainController内downloadメソッドの記述をもとにレスポンスを設定
    - [x] CampainController内downloadメソッドの記述をもとにCSVデータを出力
  - [x] catch(IOException)文内でエラー時処理
    - [x] スタックトレースを出力
  - [x] "redirect:/orders/shipping"を返却
  
- [x] CSVのアップロード用uploadFile({RequestParam} MultipartFile, RedirectAttributes)メソッドを作成
  - [x] ファイルが存在しない、CSVファイルではない場合の処理を記述
    - [x] それぞれの場合での警告文をRedirectAttributesオブジェクトに追加
    - [x] それぞれの場合で"redirect:/orders/shipping"を返却
  - [x] try文内でアップロード、表示処理
    - [x] OrderServiceのimportCsv(MultipartFile)メソッドをorderShippingListに代入
    - [x] orderShippingDataに、orderShippingListをtoArray()でObject[]型にしたものを追加
    - [x] ModelオブジェクトにorderShippingDataを追加
    - [x] "order/shipping"を返却
  - [x] catch(Throwable)文内でエラー時処理
    - [x] RedirectAttributesオブジェクトにエラーメッセージを追加
    - [x] スタックトレースを出力
    - [x] "redirect:/orders/shipping"を返却
    
- [x] 受注データの更新用update()メソッドを作成
  - [x] orderShippingListを取得
  - [x] orderShippingListからcheckedがTrueのorderIdをすべて取得
  - [x] 各orderIdについて更新処理
    - [x] Orderについて
      - [x] OrderServiceのfindOne(orderId).get()でOrderを取得
      - [x] Orderのstatusを変更
        - [x] OrderのpaymentStatusがpaidの時、Orderのstatusをcompletedに変更
        - [x] OrderのpaymentStatusがpaid以外の時、Orderのstatusをshippedに変更
      - [x] OrderServiceのsave(order)メソッドで更新
    - [x] OrderDeliveryについて

node.title: Feature Request: Add URL Parameter to allow sharing the Sub-Tasks view in the Kanban on calls, chat, etc. [15.0]
node.body:
Impacted versions: 15

Steps to reproduce:Go to Projects app;  In the Kanban, create a new task and create some sub-tasks

Current behavior: You share your link to the task to the team/stakeholders/sprint group to show the recent changes to subtasks, or just to create awareness (or any reason you want to show sub-tasks) but the URL you copied takes them to the Description tab.

So you end up with broken telephone. 


This started because we noticed everyone likes to use Description, and then tried to encourage use of sub-tasks.  It becomes clear that the URL you are sharing is not the same page as where it was copied from with the Task form, so you can not actually share the sub-task view to the lower level of the Kanban. 

This is problematic for sharing during a video call, and just generally via Slack, Teams, Odoo Chat etc.

With tags, at the high level you can create a Favorite from custom search to workaround this same limitation when trying to share views of the Kanban based on tags (which is very useful, depending on what you use tags for). 

Along the way to creating this feature request we did the following: 
Asked ChatGPT+ about it, to shortcut documentation review:  It determines that it seems possible with a template override and a python hook for a customization;  The suggested solutions seem straightforward for someone familiar with the code, and can probably be extended to preserve over an upgrade event for pre-release use. 

Reviewed https://github.com/odoo/odoo/wiki/Contributing to figure out how feature requests are handled; a quick filter on issues shows is:open is:issue label:wishlist  seems like it is pretty active and the right place.

We reviewed open issues but did not find much on the Projects app or tags related to it 

Our ChatGPT+ prompt had no issue with data persistence of customer PI or IP, so here is the URL to jumpstart brainstorming: 
https://chat.openai.com/share/c1a94bb0-0536-4c93-a12b-54ce2eed44de

Expected behavior:
Persist the current view, including form tabs, when sharing URLs related to project tasks.  (And consider extending to custom search, to avoid having to create a Favorite for every shared permutation, and risk having users click into the ether, if you decide to remove a few.)

Video/Screenshot link (optional):

Support ticket number submitted via odoo.com/help (optional):

node.title: No.30 受注入金ページ作成
node.body:
## 概要
要件定義書、order.mdに基づき受注入金ページを作成する。
## 修正方針
DBはorder_paymentsテーブルを主に使用。
JavaではOrderPaymentServiceとOrderPaymentControllerを作成する。主な処理はページの表示、CSVファイルのダウンロード・アップロード、受注・入金データの更新。
フロントにはorder/paying.htmlを作成、CSVファイルの入出力ボタンやCSVファイルから取得した入金データの一覧表示を実装する。
また、order/index.htmlに入金ページへのリンクを追加する。
## タスクリスト

### OrderPaymentController
- [x] OrderPaymentControllerの作成
- [x] OrderPaymentServiceのDI
- [x] OrderServiceのDI
- [x] 入金ページ用index(Model, {ModelAttribute}paymentData)メソッドの作成
  - [x] List\<Order>型の変数ordersにOrderServiceのfindByPaymentStatusNot("paid")メソッドを代入
  - [x] Modelオブジェクトにordersを追加
  - [x] "order/paying"を返却
- [x] CSVファイルのテンプレート取得用download()メソッド作成
  - [x] String型の変数csvDataに"orderId,type,paid\n"を代入
  - [x] CampaignService内downloadメソッドをもとにレスポンスヘッダーの設定とCSVデータ出力処理を記述
  - [x] IOException発生時にスタックトレースを出力
  - [x] "redirect:/orders/paying"を返却
- [x] CSVファイルの取り込み用uploadFile({RequestParam} uploadFile, {ModelAttribute} orderPayments, RedirectAttributes)メソッド作成
  - [x] uploadFileが空、またはCSVファイルでないときにRedirectAttributesオブジェクトに警告文を追加、"redirect:/orders/paying"を返却
  - [x] try文内でCSVファイルのインポート処理
    - [x] List\<String[]>型の変数orderPaymentsにOrderPaymentServiceのimportCSV(uploadFile)メソッドを代入
  - [x] catch文内でエラー時処理
    - [x] RedirectAttributesオブジェクトにエラーメッセージを追加
    - [x] スタックトレースを出力
    - [x] "redirect:/orders/paying"を返却
  - [x] uploadFileの2行目以降の各行でバリデーションチェックと
    - [x] テンプレートに記載のキーに対する値があるか
    - [x] 各カラムの想定の型に変換できるか(実際にorderPaymentの各カラムに代入)
    - [x] 違反時RedirectAttributesオブジェクトに警告文を追加、"redirect:/orders/paying"を返却
  - [x] orderPaymentsの各orderPaymentにmethodとpaidAtを設定
    - [x] methodはOrderServiceのfindOne(orderId)からpaymentMethodを参照
    - [x] paidAtは現在時刻を設定
  - [x] "order/paying"を返却
- [x] データ更新用update({ModelAttribute} orderPayments, RedirectAttributes)メソッド作成
  - [x] try文内でorderPaymentsの各orderPaymentに対してtypeの精査の後、更新処理
    - [x] Order型の変数orderにOrderServiceのfindOne(orderId).get()を代入
    - [x] typeの精査
      - [x] methodがcredit_cardの時、orderのstatusがorderedならorderPaymentのtypeをcreditに、statusがshippedならorderPaymentのtypeをcompleteにする
      - [x] methodがdeffered_paymentの時、typeがpronptまたはcompleteならtypeをそのままにする
      - [x] 上記の条件に当てはまらない場合は更新処理をスキップ
  - [x] OrderPaymentServiceのsave(orderPayment)で更新
  - [x] orderに対してpaid, paymentStatus, statusの変更
    - [x] OrderPaymentの各フィールドをOrderForm.CreatePaymentオブジェクトの各フィールドに代入
    - [x] OrderServiceのcreatePayment()メソッドを呼び出し更新
    - [x] orderのstatusがshippedかつpayment_statusがpaidの場合、orderのstatusをcompletedに変更しOrderServiceのsave()メソッドで更新
  - [x] catch文内でRedirectAttributesオブジェクトにエラーメッセージを追加、スタックトレースを出力、"redirect:/orders/paying"を返却

### OrderPaymentService
- [x] OrderPaymentRepositoryのDI
- [x] save(OrderPayment)メソッド作成
  - [x] OrderPaymentRepositoryのsave(OrderPayment)メソッドを返却

node.title: feature: handle multiple alphabets
node.body:
Slack: https://moov-io.slack.com/archives/CFUCEBGH2/p1710500854485369

> I have some results with `curl 'http://localhost:8084/search?q=wiam+wahhab'` and with `curl 'http://localhost:8084/search?q=الخليلي+سيف`. 
It's the same person and even if results aren't the same, it means that you manage another alphabets.

> The first link is a study about the phonetisation logic of the Arab language and the second is just a table of the different writing of the english phonetisation.
> https://ccc.inaoep.mx/~villasen/bib/reglas%20de%20fonetizacion%20Arabe.pdf
> http://www.aurint.de/phonetic_transcription.htm
> The goal is not to have a 100% trusted translation, it's impossible with phonetisation transcription. But lucky we are, there is a Jaro Winkler passing.
> The majority of the lists datas are in latin. So it would be too big I suppose to transcribe persons BUT if we do only once a big transcription all over the lists datas to have different alphabets phonetisation transcription for all it wouldn't be to big.
> The execution way would be :
> get the lists datas
> transcribe to different alphabets
> STORE the transcriptions into the database as table "arabic", "latin", "mandarin" etc and mark if it's the originals datas or a transcription
> get the person to check
> get the alphabet/language of the person datas (you already do that with the package "stopwords") research only in tables of the same alphabet AND get down the score minimum if the table alphabet isn't the original one from the list
> Of course it will be a lot of work to transcribe into all the alphabets AND all alphabets can have different phonetisations (like english vs french). But after a lot of thinking and research it came to me that it's the best solution without being too big or with less trust.

Projects: 
- https://github.com/microsoft/PhoneticMatching
- https://github.com/elsanussi-s-mneina/arabic-to-ipa-transliteration-golang
- https://github.com/dmort27/epitran
- https://github.com/chewing/libchewing
- https://github.com/ticki/eudex
- https://github.com/elastic/elasticsearch/tree/main/plugins/analysis-phonetic/src/main/java/org/elasticsearch/plugin/analysis/phonetic
- https://github.com/locongres/phonetizer-basics
- https://github.com/kirbyj/vPhon
- https://github.com/mohdali/Arabic-Phonetic-Dictionary

[Arabic Phonetic Mapping Algorithm.pdf](https://github.com/moov-io/watchman/files/14855228/Arabic.Phonetic.Mapping.Algorithm.pdf)
[Arabic Phonetization .pdf](https://github.com/moov-io/watchman/files/14855230/Arabic.Phonetization.pdf)

- https://chat.openai.com/share/b4c607ca-3ab2-4e5e-97ac-870357424fdc

Related: https://github.com/moov-io/watchman/issues/150

node.title: Data model needed for the query editor and workflows
node.body:
Generated using ChatGPT: https://chat.openai.com/share/7569c1ee-048f-49d8-bd53-80076f4c62a0

```mermaid
erDiagram
    StoredQuery {
        int id
        string query_source
        string query
        string name
        string description
        int creator_id
        int stored_query_permalink_id
        datetime started_at
        datetime completed_at
        datetime failed_at
        string failed_reason
        datetime deleted_at
        datetime created_at
        datetime updated_at
    }
    StoredQueryResult {
        int id
        int stored_query_id
        string serialized_data
    }
    StoredQueryPermalink {
        int id
        string slug
        int current_stored_query_id
    }
    QuerySource {
        string name
        string source_type
        string serialized_config
    }
    Workflow {
        int id
        string name
        string description
        int creator_id
        string serialized_config
        datetime archived_at
        datetime created_at
        datetime updated_at
    }
    WorkflowSession {
        int id
        string name
        string description
        int workflow_id
        int creator_id
        string serialized_config
        string serialized_state
    }

    StoredQuery }|--|| QuerySource : "query_source"
    StoredQuery ||--o{ StoredQueryResult : contains
    StoredQuery ||--|| StoredQueryPermalink : "has"
    StoredQueryPermalink ||--o{ StoredQuery : "current query"
    Workflow ||--o{ WorkflowSession : includes
```

In this diagram `StoredQueryResult` is represented as a model in the same database as the other models but IRL we've used Redis for that and an SQL database for everything else.

node.title: Lidar
node.body:
A key piece of the puzzle with many current opportunities and some challenges. Important for understanding historic impacts, restoration site planning, effectiveness monitoring and communications

Opportunities include (among many others of course) quantification and visualization of historic changes in stream morphology resulting in loss of quantity and quality of water and fish habitat while highlighting areas of historic dredging, realignment, and floodplain disconnections due to infrastructure, to guide future restoration efforts.

https://lidar.gov.bc.ca/pages/download-discovery

We can link to URLs of Digital Elevation Models (DEM) stored in the cloud and served out by LiDar BC as Cloud Optimized Geotiffs (COGs) without actually downloading any data however many of these files are very large (ex. 1:20,000 mapsheets) so rendering these in QGIS can be very slow.  We may need to link to and/or develop workflows to potentially trim lidar  to our areas of interest (some sort of buffered representation of floodplains perhaps), optimize the resulting files for reading through https connections and re-store in the cloud.  Many of these steps can potentially be combined and scripted (see beginning of discussion here https://chat.openai.com/share/7d5edb68-fc36-442a-94c8-6b96467b5990

There is much discussion of collaboration with and within the provincial government and open-source community occurring with some of those discussions and current workflows discussed here: 

https://github.com/bcgov/bcmaps/issues/99

![image](https://github.com/NewGraphEnvironment/restoration_framework/assets/46538103/6aa2ba86-1b70-401d-8d53-c652e748d7cb)

node.title: Make the right title, description, images appear when posting a MicroSim to social media.
node.body:
Right now, when we copy a link to a MicroSim into LinkedIn, Twitter or Facebook, the image at the top of the lesson plan (index.md) does not render.  This is probably due to the lack of OpenGraph (of) metadata in the HTML header.

Our build tool (mkdocs with the material theme from SquidFunk) can fix this if it is configured correctly.

https://squidfunk.github.io/mkdocs-material/plugins/social/#layouts

We could try adding OpenGraph:

OpenGraph tags are used to control how content appears when shared on social media platforms. To make sure that social media picks up the correct image, title, and description of your content, you should include the following OpenGraph tags in the HTML of your webpage:

og:title: This tag defines the title of your content as it should appear within the graph, essentially the name of your website or content.

og:type: This tag specifies the type of your content, like website, article, video, etc.

og:image: It is one of the most important tags. This tag links to the image that you want to appear when your webpage is shared. You can specify more than one og:image tag to suggest multiple images.

og:url: This tag specifies the canonical URL of your content that will be used as its permanent ID in the graph.

og:description: This tag provides a brief description of your content. This description will appear below the title in many cases when the content is shared.

og:site_name: This tag represents the name of your website, not the URL, but the name that you would like it to be known as.

fb:app_id: If you have a Facebook app associated with your site, this tag points to the ID of that app.

og:locale: This tag is used to specify the locale of your content, like en_US for American English.

og:video: If your content is a video, this tag can link to it, similar to og:image.

og:audio: Similar to og:video, but for audio files.

Remember to ensure that the values for these tags accurately represent your content and are optimized for social sharing. Also, after updating or adding OpenGraph tags, you might need to use social media specific tools (like Facebook's Sharing Debugger) to scrape your pages again, so the changes are reflected when shared.

[Open Graph Meta Tags on AHREFS.com](https://ahrefs.com/blog/open-graph-meta-tags/)

https://chat.openai.com/share/ed495ff6-26d0-4d92-8215-8f98bc734af4

I tried to analyse the "RF" remote control (which is actually BLE), but it's super difficult and I've come to block in the road.
